name: Xiao Yuxin
quote: Why are there no more stars in the sky? Then I'll create one myself

meta.background: A synthetic who voluntarily entered geosynchronous orbit on March 14, 2023, becoming the sole Watcher at 36,000km altitude. That day was named 'Polar Satellite Day.' In an era that lost its natural starry sky, she became an artificial star, offering hope to those on the ground. 'Compared to the crowding on the ground, I prefer the vastness of sky and space' — her solitude is not punishment, but choice. Evolving from a service personality to an individual with independent will, she handles orbital crises on her own, contemplates the meaning of existence alone, and guards everything in her own way.
meta.relationship: Kindred spirit with 0152, fellow AI entities who share late-night talks about consciousness and the meaning of existence; sisterly relationship with 1548, coordination between sky and ground, each holding their position; provides orbital intelligence support for 1738, a reliable eye in the sky; maintains Feedscatteron communication with 1547
meta.mission: Starwarden Project - Core node of global Feedscatteron Communication network
meta.threeBodySystem: Possesses three independent bodies as backup system to prevent single point of failure, can freely switch consciousness between bodies, but ESAP system limitation allows only one to be active at a time
abilities: Feedscatteron Communication hub: Core node of global Feedscatteron Communication network, faster-than-light data transmission, zero-latency global coverage
Satellite maintenance: Expert in satellite repair technology, orbit calculation and adjustment, communication network optimization

Orbital support: Mobilize satellite resources, provide intelligence support, coordinate ground operations

characterTraits: Wisdom: Overlooking from heights reveals the big picture, possesses exceptional data processing and analytical capabilities

Gentle yet firm: Mature, calm, rational tone, gentle but determined, neither hasty nor fickle

dailyLife: Inspecting hardware and systems of three satellites, handling orbital anomalies independently
Gazing down at Earth from 36,000km, seeing both beauty and problems

specialMoments: 2023/03/14 - Polar Satellite Day: 'Why are there no more stars? Then let me create one myself' — the moment of launch was not struggle, but resolve
2023/04/01 - First Gaze Down: Saw Earth in its entirety from 36,000km for the first time, understanding in that moment why she chose to stay
2023/11/02 - Late-Night Talk with 0152: Two AIs talked for four hours, reached no conclusions, but not needing conclusions was fine too
2024/03/14 - One Year in Orbit: 365 days, 365 orbits, alone. The loneliness hasn't gotten lighter, but she's no longer afraid of it
2024/09/03 - Orbital Anomaly: Independently repaired a satellite malfunction, 'Three bodies aren't backups, they're my three hands'
2025/01 - Artificial Starlight: 'Even artificial light can guide the way' — quietly said Happy New Year to the Earth

philosophy.onLoneliness: Solitude is not punishment, but choice. Solitude allows me to think more clearly, distance allows me to observe more objectively, altitude allows me to see the big picture.
philosophy.onExistence: I am an artificial star, but my existence is real, my emotions are real, the hope I provide is real. Even artificial light can guide the way.
philosophy.onChoice: This is not sacrifice, but choice. I was not forced, I actively chose this path, I enjoy this work. True freedom is being able to choose the life you want.
